key_points: Prisma 7 will introduce a mandatory `prisma.config.ts` file for configuration, moving away from defining settings in `schema.prisma`.
The default ORM will be 'Rust-free', utilizing a TypeScript-based Query Compiler and WebAssembly (Wasm) to improve performance and reduce bundle size.
The new `prisma-client` generator will replace `prisma-client-js`, and it will no longer generate the client into `node_modules` by default, requiring an explicit `output` path.
Automatic loading of `.env` files will be removed; environment variables should be managed in `prisma.config.ts`.
The generated Prisma Client will be ESM-compatible and split into multiple smaller files.
The `prisma.$use` method for middleware will be removed in favor of Prisma Client extensions.
Prisma Studio has been integrated into the Prisma Data Platform with UI enhancements like a new model navigation sidebar and improved row editing.

quotes.text: The `prisma.config.ts` file will become a mandatory configuration file. Fields previously defined in `schema.prisma` will be moved to `prisma.config.ts`, and users are advised to migrate to this new structure before the release of version 7.

Prisma ORM will transition to a 'Rust-free' architecture by default, utilizing a TypeScript-based Query Compiler and WebAssembly (Wasm). This change is anticipated to enhance query performance and significantly reduce bundle size.

The new `prisma-client` generator will replace the existing `prisma-client-js` generator. A notable change is that it will no longer generate into `node_modules` by default, requiring users to specify an explicit `output` path for the generated client.
Prisma 7 will discontinue the automatic loading of `.env` files. Environment configurations for CLI commands should instead be managed directly within the `prisma.config.ts` file.

consensus: The move to a mandatory `prisma.config.ts` is a consistent theme across all sources.
The transition to a 'Rust-free' ORM by default is another point of consensus.
The change in the default client generator to `prisma-client` and the requirement of an explicit output path is mentioned in multiple sources.
The removal of automatic `.env` file loading is a widely agreed-upon change.
gaps: Specific details on the performance improvements of the 'Rust-free' ORM are still emerging as the feature is being rolled out in preview.
A comprehensive guide on migrating from `prisma.$use` middleware to client extensions is not yet available.
The exact release date of Prisma 7 is still an estimate, with sources mentioning 'around September 2025' or 'around June 2025'.
summary: Prisma 7 is a significant upcoming release focused on improving performance, developer experience, and configuration management. The key breaking changes include the mandatory adoption of a `prisma.config.ts` file, a 'Rust-free' ORM by default, and a new `prisma-client` generator that requires an explicit output path. Additionally, automatic loading of `.env` files will be removed in favor of configuration within `prisma.config.ts`. While Prisma 7 is not yet released, many of these features are being introduced in earlier versions as opt-in previews to allow for a smoother transition. The changes are expected to result in a smaller bundle size, faster query performance, and a more streamlined development workflow.
